results.headline: Ukraine War: Top Reconstruction Official to Miss Key German Forum
results.summary: Ukraine’s top bureaucrat tasked with reconstruction will miss this year’s showcase conference for donors because of internal political bickering, risking the impression that recovery’s not a priority in Kyiv.

results.headline: Most Thais Not Satisfied With Srettha Government’s Performance, Nida Poll Shows
results.summary: Most Thais are unhappy with the performance of Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s government since it took power nine months ago as it has failed to resolve the country’s problems, according to an opinion poll.

results.headline: Hungarians Rally in Support of Orban Rival on Eve of EU Vote
results.summary: Thousands of Hungarians took to the streets Saturday to protest the policies of Prime Minister Viktor Orban in the final hours of an election campaign for European Parliament and local municipalities.

results.headline: Bulgaria Elections: Sanctioned Mogul Set to Be Kingmaker in Vote
results.summary: As Bulgaria votes in its sixth election in three years, the path out of the country’s prolonged political stalemate may involve a power broker sanctioned for corruption.

results.headline: Vietnam Detains Journalist for Facebook Posts Against the State
results.summary: Vietnam police arrested independent journalist Truong Huy San for posting articles on Facebook “that infringe on the interests” of the government, according to a post on the Ministry of Public Security’s website.

results.headline: Businessman Says He Bribed Menendez With Mercedes to ‘Kill’ Case
results.summary: A New Jersey businessman told a federal jury that he bribed US Senator Robert Menendez with a Mercedes-Benz convertible “to get power and influence” and “kill” a state criminal probe.

results.authors: By Michael O'Boyle and Maria Elena Vizcaino
results.headline: Peso Posts Worst Week in Four Years as Traders Rush For Exit
results.summary: The Mexican peso is wrapping up the worst week in four years as a surprise election outcome sent traders rushing to unwind one of the most crowded positions in global currency markets.

results.authors: By S'thembile Cele and Antony Sguazzin
results.headline: South Africa’s Leftist EFF Spurns Tie-Up With Centrist Rival
results.summary: South Africa’s leftist Economic Freedom Fighters said it won’t join a government that includes the centrist Democratic Alliance and Freedom Front Plus parties, potentially derailing a proposal for a broad-based alliance to rule the country. The rand strengthened.

results.headline: EU Funds Under Fresh Pressure to Dump US Stocks: ESG Regulation
results.summary: The US stock market has emerged as the most exposed to divestment after the European Union unveiled new rules limiting how freely asset managers can attach ESG labels to their funds.

results.headline: South Africa’s ANC Wants to Lead a Unity Government. Will Rivals Play Along?
results.summary: South Africa is in political limbo after May 29 elections failed to produce an outright majority.
